blame bukowski bad poetry books guardian columninputaddeventlistener'keydown' functione keycode 13 => enter key keycode 32 => space key ekeycode === 13 || ekeycode === 32 epreventdefault documentgetelementbyid'lifestylecheckboxinput'click lifestylefashionfoodrecipeslove sexhome gardenhealth fitnessfamilytravelmoneymake contributionsubscribesearch jobsdigital archiveguardian puzzles appguardian content licensing sitethe guardian appvideopodcastspicturesinside guardianguardian weeklycrosswordssearch jobsdigital archiveguardian puzzles appguardian content licensing sitefilmbooksmusicart designtv radiostageclassicalgamesbooks blogbooksdon't blame bukowski bad poetryhe made writing great poetry look easy laid truly beautiful lines time reappraise charles bukowskitony o'neillwed sep 2007 0315 edtdoes charles bukowski deserve respect
photograph corbis"everybody hates us care" infamous chant originated terraces millwall football club
sentiment sometimes feel could easily applied fans charles bukowskiwith release bukowski's fifth posthumous poetry collection people look like flowers last ecco seems good time consideration bukowski's work worthwhen looking reactions bukowski's poetry seems lack well respect despite hardcore fan base sales would make poets extremely happy
fact common accusation bukowski good poet work barely even poetry
mostly appreciative new yorker review adam kirsch still managed cheeky backhanded compliment"he bears relation poetry zane grey fiction ayn rand philosophy highly colored morally uncomplicated cartoon real thing
"bukowski's lack pretension repetitive subject matter seemingly simple free verse style often leaves poets came dodging accusations bukowskiesque
course lot people's lives indeed poets' lives blighted poverty alcohol abuse problems opposite sex
yet young poets really nervous citing bukowski influence tackling mostly universal themeshis influence everywhere era difficult give away poetry books many volumes poetry bukowski produced lifetime take shelf space contemporary poet think ofof course lot bad poets thrall bukowski great skill lay making writing great poetry seem easy
poets affect lifestyle without learning craft writing peril
look man clues poems come said writing poem ""like taking shit smell flush away writing leaving behind much stink possible"
disregard bukowski's work basis bad poetry followed wake seems bloody minded denying greatness clash mohicaned twattery sum 41in rush file away bukowski boozeaddled fluke ability lay truly beautiful line often overlooked
take lines describing genesis los angelesthis land punchedin cuffedout divided held like crucifix deathhandor take poem tragedy leaves ends heartbreaking linesand walked dark hall landlady stood execrating final sending hell waving fat sweaty arms screaming screaming rent world failed us bothreading extensive back catalogue stumble upon hundred thousand moments brilliance like thesebukowski embodies idea "punk poet" even better poets came punk scene
jim carroll patti smith thrall romanticism rimbaud truly "speak plain"
bukowski's machine gun delivery creates poetry actually relates backtobasics ethos punk rockunlike poets bukowski also master prose writer
favourite work bukowski's short story collection hot water music
1983 anthology bukowski prime contains best writing man ever produced death father parts heartbreaking yet ghoulishly funny dissection days following father's death
hangover opens shocking premise narrator awoken hangover recollection night accused molesting neighbour's daughters alcoholic blackout
quite bernadette features attentiongrabbing opener "i wrapped towel around bloody cock called doctor's office"
stories share writing style totally pared back view humanity cynical deadpan almost entirely without judgmentunfortunately posthumous poetry collections patchy best
indisputable act necrophilia ecco exploiting dead poet's odds ends years mercilessly sullying back catalogue one america's greatest contemporary poets
since thankfully new collection supposedly marks end acts desecration maybe time bukowskidoubters calmly reappraise man's work laying aside former prejudices
